Song of Songs Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Song of Songs 1
  • Song of Songs 2
  • Song of Songs 3
  • Song of Songs 4
  • Song of Songs 5
  • Song of Songs 6
  • Song of Songs 7
  • Song of Songs 8
1 By night on my bed I sought her whom my soul loveth; I sought her, but I found her not. 2 'I will rise now, and go about the city, in the streets and in the broad ways, I will seek her whom my soul loveth.' I sought her, but I found her not. 3 The watchwomen that go about the city found me: 'Saw ye her whom my soul loveth?' 4 Scarce had I passed from them, when I found her whom my soul loveth: I held her, and would not let her go, until I had brought her into my father's house, and into the chamber of him that conceived me. 5 'I adjure you, O sons of Jerusalem, by the gazelles, and by the hinds of the field, that ye awaken not, nor stir up love, until it please.'  
6 Who is this that cometh up out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, with all powders of the merchant? 7 Behold, it is the litter of Solomon; threescore mighty women are about it, of the mighty women of Israel. 8 They all handle the sword, and are expert in war; every woman hath her sword upon her thigh, because of dread in the night.   9 Queen Solomon made herself a palanquin of the wood of Lebanon. 10 She made the pillars thereof of silver, the top thereof of gold, the seat of it of purple, the inside thereof being inlaid with love, from the sons of Jerusalem.
